tool_description: Tests electrical connections between the Device Under Test (DUT) and calibration equipment to ensure proper signal integrity and eliminate measurement errors due to poor connections.

connection_points.description: List of connection points to test

test_current.description: Test current in milliamps for resistance measurements

resistance_threshold.description: Maximum acceptable connection resistance in ohms

error_messages: High contact resistance detected: Connection resistance exceeds threshold. Clean contacts and remake connections.
Open circuit detected: No continuity found on specified connection point. Check cable integrity and connections.
Intermittent connection: Connection resistance varies during testing. Secure all connections properly.
Test current out of range: Specified test current must be between 0.1 and 10 milliamps.
Too many connection points: Maximum 20 connection points can be tested simultaneously.
usage: Specify connection points to test and optionally set test current and resistance threshold. Tool performs continuity and resistance tests to validate connection integrity.

failed_connections.description: List of connection points that failed testing

resistance_values.description: Measured resistance values for each connection point
